content: Restoration of entitlement to educational assistance and relief for veterans affected by school closure or disapproval. Restoration of entitlement for veterans impacted by school closure or disapproval, ensuring that educational assistance payments are not deducted from entitlement or counted against the aggregate period of assistance. The Secretary may restore entitlement for veterans affected by school closure or disapproval of a necessary course, allowing them to continue their education without deductions from their assistance entitlement. The period for which educational assistance is not charged against entitlement shall not exceed the portion of enrollment where credit was not received or training time was lost, as determined under subsection (b)(2), plus the extension of a monthly stipend. The Secretary may approve a disapproved course for individuals pursuing education under specific chapters if it's in their best interest. This applies to veterans affected by school closure or course disapproval, allowing them to continue education without deductions from their assistance entitlement. The Secretary must notify individuals enrolled in courses using educational assistance under specific chapters within five business days of a school closure. This notification includes details of the closure and its impact on the individual's entitlement to educational assistance. The amendment to subsection (a) of section 3680 includes changes to the monthly housing stipend for educational assistance recipients. The Secretary has the authority to make adjustments to the stipend in certain circumstances. The Secretary has the authority to continue paying allowances to eligible veterans and persons during temporary closures of educational institutions or emergency situations, with a limit of four weeks per 12-month period. Additionally, allowances can be paid for awarding a monthly housing stipend after a permanent closure of an institution or disapproval of a course of study. The amendments allow for the continuation of stipend payments to eligible individuals during school closures or disapprovals, with a limit of 120 days after the closure or disapproval. The effective date of these amendments is 90 days after the enactment of the Act. The Act applies to education programs discontinued after January 1, 2015.
